cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles (95 km) southwest of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Hispaniola this weekend, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico early Tuesday and curve northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana or upper Texas coast (north-central Gulf Coast)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system not expected to track over, or offshore from, Detroit-Wayne County Port, MI)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; Cuban provinces of Las Tunas, Holguin, Guantanamo, Santiago de Cuba, and Granma (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (incl. Vieques & Culebra), U.S. Virgin Islands, northern & southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern coast of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos Islands (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles this weekend, then northern Gulf Coast (LA / upper TX) mid-week
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed near Michigan (closest tabulated sites are along the Gulf Coast)
